senses.sense_definition: A unit of measurement for retinal illuminance, used to correct light measurements entering the human eye based on the size of the pupil.

examples.text: The scientist calculated the retinal illuminance in <w>trolands</w> to account for the dilation of the subject's pupils.
One <w>troland</w> represents the amount of light reaching the retina when looking at a surface of specific luminance through a standard pupil size.
